body.p: The HTML pages that define a Webhelp Responsive output are obtained based on the HTML template pages.
Depending on their function, there are four types of template pages:

ol.li: main page template that is used to produce the home page of the Webhelp Responsive output.
topic template used to generate the HTML pages associated with a topic.
search template used to generate the HTML page that presentes the search results.
index terms used when generating the HTML page that presents the index terms from the documentation.

section.title: WebHelp main page template
section.p: This template is used to generate the main/home page of the Webhelp Responsive output.

Basically, the main page contains links to the main topics of the publication which can be presented in two modes: tiles and tree. For instance, the next screen-shot is for the variant that present a tile for each root topic. The top part of the page contains a menu with links to the topics.
